intro: Galium mairei, commonly known as the Maire bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early autumn. Galium mairei thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves and flowers are often used in traditional Māori medicine for their purported healing properties.
